pr_title: Make SAME Pool on DeterministicTaskQueue more Realistic

timeline.message:
Make SAME Pool on DeterministicTaskQueue more Realistic

By forking off the `SAME` pool tasks and executing them in random order,
we are actually creating unrealisticc scenarios and missing the actual order
of operations (whatever task that puts the task on the `SAME` queue will always
run before the `SAME` queued task will be executed currently).
Also, added caching for the executors. It doesn't matter much, but saves some objects
and makes debugging a little easier because executor object ids make more sense.

timeline.bodyText:
Could we instead return EsExecutors.newDirectExecutorService(); if Names.SAME.equals(name)?
Should we also return the same (non-direct) executor service each time too rather than constructing a new one each time?
timeline.author: DaveCTurner

replies.bodyText:
Should we also return the same (non-direct) executor service each time too rather than constructing a new one each time?

I mean for all other names, your change to cache them by name looks good but I don't think we need to distinguish the non-direct executors from each other either.
replies.author: DaveCTurner

replies.bodyText: Yea you're right on both points. Much simpler now :)
replies.author: original-brownbear

timeline.author: DaveCTurner
